page.title: 05EVENTS
page.content: TALYBONT SHOW The Talybont and North Cardiganshire Agricultiural and Horticultural Show Society was established in 1894,and is now held annually on August Bank Holiday Saturday on the Black Lion fields.Originally it was only trotting races but over the last 91 years it has developed considerably to include something of interest to everybody. The fields are divided into sections with two rings near the river Leri reserved for horses,the sheep are penned on the bank and two cattle rings are placed near the top of the field.Competitors start arriving as early as 7.30 having travelled from many parts of Wales and some from over the border.Judging of the horses starts at 9.30 and the cattle and sheep at 10.00.At 10.45 the main tent closes for judging and it cont.
